snippet: Young adults in Iran who came of age after the revolution have resigned themselves to making the best of a bad situation.
abstract: Tehran Journal; Iranians who were born after the 1979 revolution have resigned themselves to making the best of a bad situation; calling themselves the 'burned generation', they feel their ambitions have been boxed in by the political decisions of Iran's leaders and the foreign pressures that followed.

byline.contributor: Ramtin Rastin and Somaye Malekian contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Young adults in Iran who came of age after the revolution have resigned themselves to making the best of a bad situation.

headline.seo: Young Iranians Confront a Constricted Future
headline.main: Pinched Aspirations of Iran’s Young Multitudes
headline.print_headline: Pinched Aspirations of Iran’s Young Multitudes
